s: You know that Clifford Brown's ... but Max Roach's performance is great, all while Harold Land sounds marvelous on Saxophone and works perfectly in tandem with Clifford Brown here. This band can't be beat. ... This is certainly not an audiophile recording but the source material may not lend itself to that. None the less, this is one more great value from waxtime. ... I have this on CD but I am migrating to vinyl...

t: ROACH,MAX - The Complete Max Roach 1958-1962 - Amazon.com Music
s: The package says 9 full albums ... of 8 from Rich vs Roach (bonus cuts I suppose?). So, only 4 stars for that and the fact that some albums on this set are a bit lame. Disc 4 is insanely long, almost 83 minutes! That really tests the limits of CD format....

t: Roach, Max - To the Max! - Amazon.com Music
s: Don't come to this if you are expecting a revalation about Max Roach. Most of the music on To The Max-recorded in the 1990s-goes back to ideas he first explored on It's Time, 1962. Basically, this is blues with a chior. Of course, the 1990s were not the 1960s, and the Civil Rights urgancey ...

ROACH,MAX - Drums Unlimited - Amazon.com Music
s: For me as a professional jazz drummer, Max Roach is one of the top three drummers that the world has ever seen. This album has long been one of my favourites from him and although - to me - the CD lacks the immediacy of the vinyl recording, the music is superb.

t: Amazon.com: (VINYL LP) The Charles Mingus Quintet Plus Max Roach: CDs & Vinyl
s: I suspect that audience reception had something to do with the shift from what I am sure the audience deemed avant garde to a more familiar style. Still, there are three Mingus compositions of the six tracks: Drums (co-composed with Max Roach), Haitian Fight Song and Love Chant.

t: Max Roach Vinyl Records — Dutch Vinyl Record Store
s: Max Roach (1924-2007) was an American jazz drummer, composer, and bandleader. He was a pioneer of bebop, and is widely regarded as one of the most influential drummers in jazz history.Roach's most notable albums include Drums Unlimited (1966), Percussion Bitter Sweet (1961), and We Insist!

t: Clifford Brown & Max Roach (Vinyl): Clifford Brown & Max Roach: Amazon.ca: Music
Award-Winning Drummer - Max Roach - Amazon.com
s: I can promise you, if you are a fan of jazz, especially Max Roach, then you need to PLEASE invest in this one! It's tough to fathom why it hasn't been reviewed yet. It really is a thing of beauty! Max Roach simply puts on a dazzling show, and does an excellent job leading this solid quintet.
